name: Niebauer v. Schultz, Admr., Appellant, et al.

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Niebauer v. Schultz, Admr., Appellant, et al.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The facts and the law applicable to this case are admirably stated in the learned opinion of President Judge Keller of the Superior Court. The judgment is affirmed on bis opinion as reported in 114 Pa. Superior Ct. 538.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: M. E. Graham, with him Gunnison, Fish, Gifford é Chapin, for appellant.
Frank B. Quinn, of English, Quinn, Leemhuis (& Tayntor, for additional defendant.
casebody.head_matter:
Niebauer v. Schultz, Admr., Appellant, et al.
Argued March 25, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
M. E. Graham, with him Gunnison, Fish, Gifford é Chapin, for appellant.
Harold F. Mook, for appellee.
Frank B. Quinn, of English, Quinn, Leemhuis (& Tayntor, for additional defendant.
April 15, 1935:
